{{ja-kanjitab|ご|おん|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|呉|tr1=go|t1=the Wú region of China|音|tr2=on|t2=sound, pronunciation}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|ご.おん|acc=h|acc2=a|acc_ref=NHK,DJR|acc2_ref=DJR|y=o}}
* {{homophone|語音|五音|lang=ja|sort=こおん'}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ご.おん}}

# The pronunciation of Chinese hanzi characters used in the Wú {{zh-l|吳}} and Yuè {{zh-l|越}} regions of China.
# A category of ''on'yomi'' ({{ja-l|音読み}}), the Japanese approximation of the original Chinese pronunciation.
#: The kanji pronunciation first brought to Japan via the Korean peninsula. This category was called ''waon'' ({{ja-l|和音}}) until the middle of the [[w:Heian period|Heian Period]], after which it was also called ''goon''. Generally regarded as the character reading brought over long ago from the lower reaches of the [[Yangtze]] River (the Wú region). Contrast with ''kan'on'' ({{ja-l|漢音}}), ''sōon'' ({{ja-l|宋音}}), and ''tōon'' ({{ja-l|唐音}}).

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-l|和音|わおん|waon}}
